Posts.Content: Hi Jean, I also had a lumpectomy & SN & after 2 weeks I had the same sensitive, painful & swollen breast. I returned to hospital where the surgeon saw me immediatly & she had to cut open the scar ( not painful at all ) & pushed out lots of lumpy blood which had collected which was causing the problem. I had to have the district nurse in every day after to clean it out & dress it - 3 weeks on the wound has closed but the nurse is still coming in every day to change the dressing to make sure I dont get an infection as I have to have a mastectomy on Friday. I know this is probably not the news you want to hear with your upcoming holiday but please get it checked out before you go & ask your surgeons advice. I also saw my GP( who didnt do much) before going back to my surgeon & she(my surgeon) told me I should have gone straight back to see her & not gone to my GP seeing as it was her that operated.  I know your holiday is much needed but complications in another country may be far more stressful. Sorry to be gloom & doom & I hope all goes well for you.
Posts.Title: Infection after Lumpectomy& SNB

Posts.Content: Aw Ansi - now I know why you didnt go into it on your PM to me - you cant write all that twice. Its so great to have you back with us & Im sure Im not the only one who has thought & worried about you. Despite all you have been through you have come out still with your sense of humour in tact which is so important. I have the racoon part on my head but not grown enough to see if its crossed with a poodle - watch this space on that -- did the balloon in your abdomen come in a pack of two cos if so I have the other one in mine !!! Im still on Citalopram - docs given me another 3 months - but hey ho - if it works .............   Will keep in touch regards to Santiago - not letting you get away with that even tho you're not allowed to go by horse now - helicopter ordered if that suits ?   Take care & speak soon  French xoxo
Posts.Title: Letrozole and the blues!

Posts.Content: Ansi - forgot to ask - where in Devon are you going as I am originally from there - havent always been french !!
Posts.Title: Letrozole and the blues!

Posts.Content: Hiya Ansi The balloon was obviously full of air & floated over the channel when you let go of the string !! Never mind - must just try & concentrate on deflating it somehow - any tips will be welcomed - answers on a postcard please.   So I know what you mean about Jeffrey - think I have decided to call mine "Tyler" as she is my dog & has been there for me through all of this & taken all my rants, tears & moods & given me only love & affection in return. I also dont care how long Im on them - if they make the difference of getting through  the day with a smile on my face or not then its a no brainer.   Ooh back hair - no havent got that - got a fluffy face going on & the entire amazonian rainforest sprouted almost overnight on my legs. Wish it would grow that quick on my head although in fairness its growing faster than I thought. Doesnt it seem ages ago when we were talking about clementine nets on our heads !!!!    As regards to Chateaux Neuf - can take some with us XXX
Posts.Title: Letrozole and the blues!

Posts.Content: Hi lillylizzie - Its perfectly normal to feel as you are & you will see by reading posts on this site that you are definatly NOT alone. Since being diagnosed in Sept to where I am now, ( post mastectomy & chemo ) I have found so much help & encouragement from all on here. Any questions you have to ask there is always someone who will answer you. Its a scarey time - theres no getting away from that - but you will be surprised at how strong you will become. Losing a breast is an awful thing to come to terms with BUT its a small price to pay for being able to continue with your life cancer free. take care & good luck xx Lorna - can I ask you more info on your reconstruction please. I have to make a decision one day & am trying to find out my best options  & dont know what to expect. Thanks xx
Posts.Title: Hi everyone

Posts.Content: Hi Jan - Can I send you a request to add me to the group plea se. Thanks Sue Edwards
Posts.Title: facebook

Posts.Content: Hi  again - just quickly forgot to say - I bought some false eyelashes but never used them. I was a bit worried they would pull out the few very sparse ones I had left when removing them. I wore make up all the time going out & found with eyeliner it didnt really show I had hardly any eyelashes. Get your eyebrow pencil sorted before you loose them so to get the right colour.  I wore scarves at home & wigs when going out. xx
Posts.Title: Hairy Question

Posts.Content: hHi Jan - just tried to have a look & it just comes up a blank page - any ideas ?
Posts.Title: facebook

Posts.Content: Hiya - I like you couldnt contimplate the cold cap & just went with it.  So by my experience the only hair on ALL my body I didnt lose was the hairs on my forearms. Why they stayed I havent a clue ??!! I finished my chemo on 28th March & had 25 sessions of rads which finished 2 weeks ago. To give you a bit of encouragement as I know the thought of losing my hair was just too awful - I actually took the bull by the horns on Thursday last & went to the bakery, local co-op & bank without my wig for the 1st time -- yesterday I went for a meal with a friend to the chinese & last night to the local bar - both wigless. My hair isnt really long at all but saying that growing back quicker than I thought & covers my scalp - I have been wearing wig since Jan 2nd. When I started losing my eyebrows I went to a "posh shop" that sold make-up & explained to the girl that I wanted an eyebrow pencil. She was really helpful & as I still had a few eyebrows left she matched the colour well & showed me how to put it on without it looking false & screaming "cancer" Dont know if this helps or is too much info ? Take care & anymore questions just ask; xx
Posts.Title: Hairy Question

Posts.Content: Thanks Kate - I know its all true what you say as there is no quick fix. It just seems to be so much harder than usual with the meds. One good thing about having an awful summer I suppose - not too many revealing summer clothes !! take care
Posts.Title: Anastrozole & weight

Posts.Content: Hi Ellen Yes we can swap - I said I would never complain about things when it was over when I was  at the start of all this as well !! I am not eating more or unhealthily but cant shift it. I crave sweet things & could kill for chocolate as I write this - luckily I havent got any !! & dont buy sweet stuff as too much temptation. Lets hope we both finally get sorted & back to how we want to be Take care xx
Posts.Title: Anastrozole & weight

Posts.Content: Hi All  Havent posted on here much for a while although still following everyones posts.  I have been on Anastrozole for about 6 weeks now & no matter how hard I try I cannot shift the weight I've put on since starting on this rollercoaster. Has anyone else had the same problems & has any tips ? Wishing all of you well xxx
Posts.Title: Anastrozole & weight

Posts.Content: Hi Senga, Thanks for posting this as I have my last chemo next Weds - 28th- & am due to start 25 sessions of Radio around the end of April. I have to go for my "tattoing" tomorrow morning. If you want I can post on here tomorrow afternoon to let you know how that goes. Be nice to compare notes but I have only heard that after chemo its a walk in the park & thats by people who have gone through the same. Take care, keep in touch & good luck friday. Suzie xx
Posts.Title: starting radiotherapy

Posts.Content: Hiya,   I didnt have any rib pain before my mx in November but ever since I feel like my ribs are permanently bruised on that side. I havent mentioned it to GP or anyone as I just take it that its all part of it. I dont wear a bra unless I go out as that seems to aggrivate it a bit after I've had it on for a while.  Dont know if this is of any help but you're not on your own. Take care xx
Posts.Title: anyone experienced painful ribs post Mx?

Posts.Content: Hiya, So pleased it went well for you - its good to read blogs for the positive things people have to say - the "bad" experiences are good too, not to panic anyone but to prepare for what "may" happen.   I hope your FEC S/E's remain minimal. Mine were very do-able, so keep taking the anti sickness drugs as they do work & just give in to sleep when you need to;   Take care xx
Posts.Title: A good FEC experience!

Posts.Content: Hi Janice, I had a mx last Nov & start my 1st Tax on weds after 3 FEC. After my 3rd FEC I went into compleat meltdown after keeping so strong & positve up til then. All the same things that you described feeling. I knew I had to get a grip on things for my kids & my sanity so I went to see my GP who has prescribed me MILD anti depressents. I have never been depressed in my life but then again I have never been through cancer before. One week on these & I am back to my "normal" positive self. Not a tear in sight thankfully.   None of us going through this nightmare can expect to sail through it emotionally - go & talk to your GP & if he/she prescribes anti depressants then take them - it wont be forever & sometimesz we need something just to help us get through the "bad" times ( its all bad but there are bad & bad arnt there ?)   I hope this has helped a bit. Take care & dont forget that every day passed is a day nearer beating this xx
Posts.Title: So close to the end of treatment yet finding it so hard

Posts.Content: Hi Jeanne, Where abouts in France do you live as I also live there so obviously am having my treatment here.
Posts.Title: Lumpectomy or double masectomy

Posts.Content: Hi Elaine - I'm in the middle of it all i.e. I have a partner but we dont live together. He has been there for me since my diagnosis, through my mx & treatments but on his terms. He comes down & sees me when he feels like it - has boosted my moods loads of times with his off the wall sense of humour but when I have been at my darkest he stays away - just at the times when I've really needed him. I have had to try to be upbeat when I least feel like it as I know he wont come down if he knows Im on a downer. Typical man really - cant change things so doesnt know how to deal with it so distances himself. He has at times been there & held me in the night when I havent been able to stop crying but not as often as I would have liked. So I know what its like to lie there in the dark alone & frightened with your thoughts - its always worse at nights isnt it. I have tried to read, watched all sorts of rubbish on TV - anything to distract my thoughts.  Saying that I couldnt have got through this without him despite his faults & I am lucky enough to have my  14 yr old son with me who I've had to be strong for & my 18 yr old son who phones me often as he has lived abroad since Feb. Keep positive & in control of more than the remote. We are all strong whatever circumstances we find ourselves in - we owe it to ourselves & our future to stay positive. take care & remember theres always someone here who you can have a chat or rant to. xx
Posts.Title: Relationships and cancer

Posts.Content: Hi Sue, Firstly good luck with your 1st radio tomorrow. I start mine April 23rd after a mastectomy in Nov followed by 6 chemo sessions which finished 2 weeks ago. I am due to start on Arimidex after chemo & would be interested to see if you have any side effects eventually. I know we are all different & I dont get "scared" into things I read but just like to have info so that if I do get S/E's its good to know if they are normal or not. Good luck to you all & take care xx
Posts.Title: Anastrozole - to take or not?

Posts.Content: well all I can say is roll on summer - whilst its still winter the male species risk getting man flu & look out us women then !!!! Saying that I do not intend to offend any men who are reading this & getting annoyed because I know there is a small minority of you out there that are not the "norm"  & are capable of taking hold of the reins.
Posts.Title: Husband response - not that interested?!

Posts.Content: Hi, You must be feeling pretty low with the lack of interest from your partner. Men are wierdos sometimes & dont know how to cope with things they cant change. I am lucky enough to have a partner ( only been together for just over a year when I was diagnosed ) who supports me but at times  I know he finds it very hard without him telling me this. We dont live together & sometimes when he phones me & its a "bad day" & I am upset  he just cuts the conversation short & says he'll ring off & phone next day - that really hurts as all I want is for him to come down & give me a cuddle & I know I would be OK again but that just doesnt happen. For all his support he just cant cope with the "upset " me & although he says he's fine with my hair loss I know it makes him uncomfortable & so I make sure I keep some sort of covering on when he's around but have told him I cant sleep in it but he's doesnt look at me much when Im in my bald state which is not normally how he is.   You will be feeling so vulnerable at the moment that any coldness from him will be magnified. Perhaps he doesnt feel able to look at the book you had done for him just yet as it only confirms what you will be losing. As well as being strong for ourselves we find ourselves in the situation of having to be strong for all those closest to us as well which is really hard at times. You dont say how long its been since your diagnosis ? Its maybe not so much he's in denial but just feels so helpless & doesnt know how to react so you really have to sit him down & talk to him about it & how you feel. He may not be able to express how he feels in words - as mine cant- but actions mean so much more sometimes,n a big hug cant do wonders most of the time. Tell him how you feel & how much you need his support, you never know , once you force him to talk about it things may (hopefully) get better. Men are basically selfish creatures & need things pointing out to them. Good luck with your op - this site is great for words of encouragement & advice. Take care. xx
Posts.Title: Husband response - not that interested?!

Posts.Content: Hi Stel77 Just to give you an idea on hair growth rate. I had my last chemo on March 28th & have been going without my wig since 14th June. I was told by my friends & boyfriend that it looked good without my wig so took the plunge & havent looked back. Its surprising how quickly its growing - think its since the air, light etc has been on it all the time. I know we are all different but hope this is a helpful indicator. Its coming in like salt & pepper but to be quite honest Im just glad to have hair at the moment so am not too bothered about the colour -- YET !! Take care xx
Posts.Title: CHANGING HAIR COLOUR FROM GREY TO BLONDE AFTER CHEMO?

Posts.Content: My ex- husband - when asked by his Mum how I was & then she told him he should be taking the kids more often to help me out - well he got all annoyed & replied " Oh Sue, Sue - its all about Sue isnt it ? " !!!!!!! If he wants to change places with me & make it all about him then he's welcome --- HENCE THE FACT HE'S MY EX - HUSBAND !!!!!! Big stress on the EX !!
Posts.Title: How to make a woman going through chemo feel so much better...

Posts.Content: Just cooked my partner a full Sunday lunch - he arrived at 1 & left at 3 to go hunting. Caveman thing?! I live in France & its what the french men do here. I mumbled something about weds next as it my 3rd chemo - he replied "Oh I thought it was the weds after - (which hurt me he didnt remember) well what was it important in my head for the 25th ? Oh yes, I have a meeting with the hunt committee  about the end of season meal " If I transform myself into a wild boar then perhaps I WILL GET MORE ATTENTION !!!! Its not they dont care - its they dont think - its not happening to them - they are not like us & the sooner we accept that & the fact we cant change them then the better it will be for us. Easier said than done I know ??!!   I know he loves me to bits & worries but sometimes we just have to accept the fact they are like they are as expressing their feelings with words its difficult with the majority of them - its an alien concept & distance/coldness is their way of coping. Dont forget men dont want to be thought of as the weaker sex - but in many ways they are - especially emotionally.   Good job for this site & the support we are able to give each other xx
Posts.Title: Husband response - not that interested?!

Posts.Content: Hi Trish, Thanks for finding me again - I had mistakenly deleated this thread & couldnt find it myself. So - update. Sorry to hear about your hospital episode but maybe this will give you - & anyone else reading this - a bit of encouragement. I saw my onc & he said that he wouldnt reduce my dose & basically I would have to put up with the S/E's. When I then proceded in to have my dose of poison thats going to save my life the nurse who came to administer it asked me how I got on with the anti-sickness they infused into me before the Tax. I told her than the last 2 times it gave me panic attack - very not me - & hot flushes while it was being infused. She asked if I had any nausea after the 1st Tax - which I hadnt at all so she decided to not give me the anti sickness infusion & just the Tax. It all went great - no panic or anything so she's put on my file to leave it out for my next  one- which is my last YIPPEEEE !!!!! I had to have injection next day - as in last one - for neutrophenia. I had to order it from chemist & couldnt be bothered to get up early to collect it as I had done for the first so made an app. for the nurse to come & give it to me at 5pm. The previous one she came at 9am. Well - after that I waited & waited for the S/E's to kick in, as in awful horrendous bone pain. I am 9 days on & still waiting !! I had the chemo on the weds & it kicked in really bad on the mon night. 1st time. I have had nothing, nada, nowt, zilch, rien !!!!  Well the plot thickens - or does it ?? I happened to look at the leaflet for S/E's that comes with the injection - which cost 1,370 euros by the way !! For one injection !! Thats the beauty of here in France & having to go to chemist to get all meds. Sorry - got side tracked -- bone pain was marked for 1 in 10 people & clearly marked in dark bold print -- " Only to be administered 24 hours or more AFTER last chemo" Well this time due to my laziness I had it 28 hrs after my chemo !! Was that the reason I didnt get the pain ?? They wouldnt have put that in the notice just to fill up space. AND if this is the case WHY OH WHY didnt they tell me at the hospital ? I will definatly mention it when I go for my next one & obviously have the next injection, which they have already told me I will need, in the late afternoon & sit back & hope. I have corned beef, flaky, snakey hands back again & my feet are peeling round my toes but all do-able - oh & cardboard mouth which is now slowly going. I feel the best I've felt for months & hope this will give others a boost to think that despite all the horrors some people have with Tax - we are all different & it affects us all differently. How do you feel now ? Let me know wont you. Take care xx
Posts.Title: Taxotere side effects

Posts.Content: Hi Trish, Just to say I hope you make it to your daughters school - with or without wheelbarrow - preferably without of course. My nails are tender but as yet not lifting. I have kept them religiously hidden from the light with black nail varnish since starting with the Taxso hope its enough - cant bear the thought of loosing yet something else. I also took tramadol this time which seemed to help. Hi Susan, Glad I was able to give you some positive thoughts. I also had 3 FEC before Tax & was worried about it. I had awful nausea with Fec but no actual sickness & was really tired - more than with the Tax. Christmas day I slept 18 hrs out of 24 !! Awful then but distant memory now!! I've had a port from the start & had no probs with it & forget its there usually. Good luck with the Tax & hope you are OK for the skiing. Take painkillers as a precaution, as I did. I was prescribed Tramadol. I have lived in France for 17 yrs & I can assure you the hospitals/ health care is excellent - not that you will need it hopefully. They leave nothing to chance here. Let me know how you're doing. Take care xx
Posts.Title: Taxotere side effects

Posts.Content: Hi Janice, Thanks for your reply & it would be great if you find out anything. I have my next one on 7th March & know it makes sense to phone before to find out if they will add another session but I think I will stay in splendid ignorance seeing as its only next week - I have it in my head that the 28th March is my last one & will be gutted if it isnt so think for me a week of ignorance will be better. I dont know how they do things at my unit as everywhere seems different reading other peoples experiences. Hope you manage to get needed rest - I rest when feeling iffy but make sure the days I feel "normal" I make the most of them. Mind you "normal" sometimes seems a million years ago doesnt it ? When I eventually get my hair back I will NEVER complain about a bad hair day again.  I still have eyelashes & eyebrows - getting a bit sparse but still hanging on in there. I am about to remove & replace my nail varnish - dont know what to expect when I take it off but it will be as it is I guess - no good stressing about it.   The cortisone cream the doc gave me for my hands today seems to have calmed it somewhat which is good. Take care xx
Posts.Title: Taxotere side effects

Posts.Content: Hi Trish,   Thanks for your reply & encouragement. I will definatly ask about reduced dose but to be quite honest I would rather go through the same S/E's again than have to have another session tacked on but hopefully that wont happen & they can reduce it  regardless. I will be gutted if  that happens.   Dont seem to get a lot of support from BCN so this site helps lots. Just read your profile & you sound really strong but I must say that we have had the exact same emotions since September. Take care & I will keep posting on progress. xx
Posts.Title: Taxotere side effects

Posts.Content: Hi Trish & Susan How are you both doing ? Looking forward to my last Tax on weds. Been for my tattoos ready for radiotherapy to start on 23rd April. Take care xx
Posts.Title: Taxotere side effects

Posts.Content: Hi Trish, Had my last chemo today YIPPEEEEEE. It hasnt quite sunk in yet. I came straight home & jumped in the shower for ages - I just felt a strong need to wash all the hospital off of me - does that make sence? I'm sure it does. I felt so much better after it. The sun is blazing here & I know exactly what you mean as I also gave up housework in september so yopu're not the only one with a filthy house - hope that makes you feel better as it did me when I read you were in the same state. You made me laugh - so you're half eagle chic & half dog ?! I bet the hair on my legs & under my arms grow quicker than on my head - sods law that. My radio starts 23rd April & will have last one - all going to plan - on 31st May - my Dads birthday so thats a good a day as any to finish. I am going on Arimidex not Tamoxifen seeing as I am menopausal- that sounds like Im on a pause from men !! Keep in touch as to how its going & keep away from big birds in the garden in case they swoop on you. Take care xx
Posts.Title: Taxotere side effects

Posts.Content: Hi Trish & Janice,   Just quick update. I have developed - since Friday - a terrible rash like thing on both my hands & not quite so bad on my feet. Spent the weekend trying desperately trying not to scratch but its driven me mad & now my knuckles are slightly swollen. Went to my GP this morning & she phoned the oncology unit who said it was an allergic reaction to the Tax. They said that my next -& penultimate one - they will reduce the dose else the reaction could be worse next time. I immediately went into paranoid, panic mode -- reduced dose yelled to me reduced effectiveness. My GP assured me this is not so but if a reduced dose works just as well  then in my mind why do they give it to you at a higher dose in the first place. Am I being stupid to think like this - I just dont know anymore as all my logic seems to have left me lately.   Hope you are both doing OK - keep in touch to let me know. xx
Posts.Title: Taxotere side effects

Posts.Content: Hi Jo,   You are not on your own by any means & going by the comments here - nor am I.   I had 3 FEC which I just had mild nausea with & tiredness that came & went & then I had my 1st of 3 Tax last weds ( 15th Jan) - on Thurs & Friday I felt on top of the world - best Id felt for months & even had a dinner party on Sat night -- but am sensible enough to know it wouldnt nessesarily last & boy was I right !!   Early hours of sunday morning the "bone pains" started but manageable. Sunday was again do-able with Monday getting worse & last night I cried like a baby with the pain & ended up on the sofa with the TV on all night as a possible distraction - didnt work. At the hospital they told me that paracetamol would be enough for the pain - masochists !! I phoned my GP today & she has put me on Tramadol but reckons that I may have had double pain as I had to have an injection on Thurs as my white cell count was down & that can give you extra pains.   Like you I am apprehensive about my further two sessions to come but its got to be done.   A nurse friend of mine has told me to try & eat lots of protein.   Let me know how its going xx
Posts.Title: Taxotere side effects

Posts.Content: Thanks Janice - lets hope it wont be so bad next 2 times.   Trish - when do you have your next 2 Tax ?  Janice isnt the only person who's told me the first is the worst - hear's hoping - let me know how your doing. My pains have gone except for in my feet which are really red in colour. Also my nails are becoming quite sensitive to touch. Do you have any of these probs ?   Take care xx
Posts.Title: Taxotere side effects

Posts.Content: Hi All & thanks for your good wishes. I am now 3 days post chemo & still feel on top of the world I'm glad to report. Nenz - As you can see I have now finished my 3rd & final Tax after 3 Fec. After my 1st Tax I felt awful with the bone pain on the monday ( had it on the weds ) & it lasted about 2 days in all. Im sorry to hear you are still getting pain after so long.  I was prescribed Tramadol which helped almost immediatly to relive the pain. On the 2nd & 3rd I started taking it on the Sat morning as a preventive & it kept away all the pain on the 2nd & Im hoping it will for this 3rd & final. Did you have to have an injection for white blood cells the day after ? I did & after I had it saw in the notes with the jab that you have to wait 24hrs after the Tax before having it as it gives joint/bone pain also. I reckon thats why I had such awful pain as it was a double dose if you like. The 2nd one I made sure 24hrs had gone by & I had hardly any pain at all to speak of. I know how you must be feeling about going for your next one - very apprehensive as I was. The thought of that pain again was just too scarey. I dont know if this is of any help to you info wise ? I wish you all the best & hope you can get some pain relief soon. xx
Posts.Title: Taxotere side effects

Posts.Content: Good luck for your 1st chemo. I am at the other end having just finished 6 chemos & 25 rads. Its all do-able if daunting at the start. The unknown is far worse than the reality & after your 1st one you will have something to guage the rest on. I kept a chemo diary & wrote down anything I thought relevant i.e how I was feeling & any S/E's on what day after the chemo. I found it very helpful to look back on so knew what maybe to expect on what days & was able to be more prepared. I lived in 3 week cycles between sessions as the thought of looking at the bigger picture to the end was to much to think of - I found that it helped doing that as it passed quicker. Take care & remember every day passed is a day nearer getting back to a "normal" life. xx
Posts.Title: First chemo tomorrow

Posts.Content: Hi Pam, Sorry I cant be of much use to you but I had a left side MX on 18/11/2011 & I have rib pain on my scar side as well. Just to let you know you are not on your own with that so perhaps its not uncommon ? Dont know. No idea how long to expect it to last. Its uncomfortable more than painful & feels like a bruise. Take care xx
Posts.Title: LCIS and rib pain

Posts.Content: Have you had any physio ? I had quite bad cording in my armpit after which has been sorted by physio. I think it helped a lot in avoiding pain in my shoulder as he worked on that a lot. I only have tenderness on the scar when I touch it but in all the area going round to my back its a numbness - like getting the feeling back after having a tooth out but its always there. Strange feeling but I cant say its actually painful. Keep positive as it can only get better with time - its just impatience on our part I guess xx
Posts.Title: LCIS and rib pain

Posts.Content: Hiya - I had 3 FEC & 3 Taxotere.  I had the most awful joint/bone pain with that - which started 3 days after - so I phoned my GP who prescribed me Tramadol & it  was so much relief you wouldnt believe it. The 2nd & 3rd doses of Tax I was prepared & took tramadol on the morning of day 3 each time & suffered no pain at all. I know we are all different with S/E's & you may not get this but being forewarned is sometimes good. Take care xxx
Posts.Title: Docetaxal question

Posts.Content: Hiya - well I kept a diary of my S/E's & how I felt as it was very good to look back on each time to see what to expect on what day. I took the Tramadol for 4 days. I got an awful itchy - & I mean ITCHY rash on my hands which the doc gave me cortisone cream for. That came about a week after the Tax. I didnt feel so much tired but more lethargic & my feet ached if I was on them too long (your summer activities with your son may have to fit in with this if you get it ) Oh also I wore black nail varnish for all the time on Tax & didnt lose any nails at all. Apparently its light sensitive. Take care xx
Posts.Title: Docetaxal question

Posts.Content: Well done you - what a relief that now you can get on with the rest of your life. I have done with my chemo 3 weeks ago & now starting radio on monday. You are quite right in all you say - we do get through it although at the beginning it seems an impossible mountain to climb. You have reached the bottom of the other side & Im hot on your heels. The support on this site has been a tremendous help for me too. Take care & all the best for the future. xx
Posts.Title: Finished treatment today

Posts.Content: I had my first chemo last wednesday & I am lucky enough to report that I havent had any real noticable side effects. Today is my first day without the anti sickness drugs so will have to see how that goes. I had to go to a big family party of my parteners yesterday which was worried about as didnt want to be a party pooper & have to leave early cos of tiredness. Pleased with myself though as it started at midday & I relented at midnight & asked to be taken home - the only point of telling you this is that I found that anymore than one glass of alcohol makes me feel sick/ slightly wierd which is not normal for me so anyone who is not starting chemo til after christmas & likes a drink - make the most of it. I tried to have a couple more inb between glasses of water but to be honest it wasnt worth it. Take care x
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo Late

Posts.Content: Hi Lucy, Although I have shortish hair now I had long hair for years so I would advise you to get it cut short just so you can get used to it. Its always a big thing for us women the "no hair issue" & I had a mastectomy 4 weeks ago & my 1st chemo last weds - the thought of loosing my hair very soon is more upsetting to me than the fact I have lost a breast - how irrational is that eh ??Hair will grow back - my boob wont. Anyway if you get yours cut short now then perhaps it wont be so distressing when / if you loose it. I have my wig ready in its box & its so much like my own hair that when I gave it a whirl with my kids my eldest son was talking to me for 10 mins & didnt notice I had it on until I whipped it off ( mind you he is an 18yr old boy !! ) However I will still feel self consious wearing it when the time comes thats for sure.   In the meantime try to have a good christmas before your surgery  Take care x
Posts.Title: New to all this .....

Posts.Content: Hi Irene - I had exactly the same when I had a lumpectomy. You need to go & see your surgeon as I ended up doing. I saw my GP who said it was nothing to worry about - but I did - & eventually couldnt stand it any longer so saw my surgeon & she went mad that the doc hadnt sent me straight up to her. She ended up draining it all out - NOT PAINFULL so dont worry about that - but just disgusting as she pushed out all lumpy congealed blood. Sorry to be so blunt - just telling you how it was for me. This happened about 2-3 weeks after I had lump removed. When it was leaking I was sat with a bag & just filling it up with tissues. I hope you get sorted soon. Take care xx
Posts.Title: Advice please-wound leaking

Posts.Content: Hi jmd Your post about your Mum should be put in BIG HEADLINES at the top of the page - it is reading things like this that give all us ladies hope & morale boosts with the thought we will all beat this & live to a ripe old age & this is just a temporary blip in our lives. Thank you for that xx
Posts.Title: New to all this .....

Posts.Content: You go for it tomorrow night - why wait if you feel ok. Celebrations are good & shouldnt be put off so go have that meal & vino collapso - it will do you the world of good. xxx
Posts.Title: Docetaxol You B*****D !!!

Posts.Content: Hi Pat,   I too saw people about a lump I found about 12 months before I was diagnosed & was told it was fatty tissue. It was only because it was always a niggle in the back of my mind that I finally - insisted after a negative mammo - that I wanted more tests done. I am a single Mum & felt I owed it to my 2 boys at least. I had lost my Mum to colon cancer in 2004 & my dear sister to womb cancer a year ago. Thought I was paranoid cos of this but an echo proved my fears to be right. I am so angry at times as I could have had treatment a lot earlier than I have had. Got my 3rd chemo this weds after my mx in Nov. Try to stay positive & above all keep your sense of humour where possible as Im sure it helps the healing process. Being down & depressed doesnt change a thing except it makes us feel worse. Take care xx
Posts.Title: Age 37 shock at breast clinic yesterday. totally dazed and reeling...

Posts.Content: Hi Gil - After diagnosis in Sept, lumpectomy, mastectomy & end of chemo at end of March I am 2 weeks into radio & I can tell you - yes it is a breeze. Knowing I am on the home straight is just great & nice to be finally  feeling back to relativly normal (whatever "normal" is ?!) The marking up is nothing to worry about & doesnt hurt at all where they tattoo you - just 4 pin pricks. I have started rubbing Aloe Vera into the radio site as its supposed to help with the possible "sunburn" effect. Cant do any harm anyway. No info on hormone tabs as will be starting on Arimadex but not til after the radio. Good luck - almost at the end now - doesnt it feel great to say that ?. xxx By the way my hair is coming back with visible hairline already - look like a baby eagle !!
Posts.Title: Radio Therapy and Tamoxifen

Posts.Content: thanks for that - would be interested to know what they said the survival rate was in those days. Its LOADS higher now as we all know. Give your Mum a big hug. xx
Posts.Title: Age 37 shock at breast clinic yesterday. totally dazed and reeling...

Posts.Content: I have found a really good deodorant that I use all the time. Its Sanex & is paraben, aluminium free. It hasnt let me down yet even in the 44° summer days we have had here in France. xx
Posts.Title: Parabens

Posts.Content: Hi Sue, I really feel or you & what your going through. I started off with biopsy, lumpectomy & then ended up having to have a mastectomy mid Nov  2011. It was all so scarey as it happened in the space of 2 months. I felt like I was on a merrygoround that I couldnt get off of. I know how scared you feel, mine was found by chance as well.   I have also been trying to give up smoking for the past 6 months as I have had loads of tests which have all come back negative & to carry on smoking is just CRAZY. Its not as easy as I have found it to give up in the past e.g I gave up for 12 years when I found I was pregnant with my 1st son,( now 18 ), just like that as was scared of the effects it would have on my unborn child. Why oh why I dont manage it now knowing the effects on myself is beyond me. Soooo I know where you are there - I give it up for about 3/4 days then I get a bad few days & start again. Maybe only 3 or 4 a day but all the same .......   Scream if you want, it wont change things but might make you feel better. I miss my sister terribly as she died aged 55 in April 2010. I go outside at night into the garden , pick the brightest star - who is my sis looking down on me - & rant & rave to her. Do what you need to do - dont feel crazy as we all have our ways of coping with our demons. You will cope & get through this as we all will. I have said before but will say again - everyday passed is a day nearer to beating this & being well again.   Take care & PM me if you need a rant xx
Posts.Title: Just need a hug

Posts.Content: Hi - What you are experiencing is normal - 4 days after my first T I couldnt move without it hurting, every bone in my body ached, I couldnt bare to stand up for more than a couple of minutes & spent the night on the sofa crying in pain. I phoned my GP the next day & she prescribed me Tramadol & they worked wonders. For my next 2 T I took them at day 3 as a precaution & didnt have anything like the pain at all. Also after my 1st T my hands became itchy & on fire - unbearable with the skin peeling off my hands & feet - I also got cream from the docs which calmed it all down.  I was warned about nail loss so wore black nail varnish throughout my T on both nails & toenail - still wearing it 4 weeks after last one. Apparently its light sensitive. I havent had any nail loss at all so it worked for me - couldnt bare the thought of losing anything else. Good luck with the rest of your treatment. xx
Posts.Title: Pain after having chemo

Posts.Content: Hi Amanda - you asked at what stage we are at & by your last posting I hope I can give you a bit of a cheer-up. I was diagnosed in sept 2011, had a biopsy in October & a mastectomy in November. The thought of the chemo filled me with horror. I started it in Dec & managed to keep my hair until 3rd Jan when I went to my best mates armed with the clippers & a big bottle of wine. Losing my hair has been more stressful than losing my boob but even that I've got used to now. I have just got a 2nd more "funky" wig which everyone loves. I had my last chemo on March 28th & cant believe its finally finished. I lived in 3 week cycles so perhaps thats why it seemed to go quicker than I ever imagined. I did get side effects - but they dont last forever & I am still here to tell the tell & now fighting fit ( Well I will be ) to continue with me life. I have 25 sessions of radio starting on April 23rd so will be finished 31st May. You will get through it as impossible as it seems at the beginning - it seems an impossible mountain to climb but with guts & determination - positive thinking & as much humour as you can muster you will get there a stronger person at the end of it. I was trying to get my waitressing job back but I heard the restaurant is now looking for topless waitresses - my arguement is that they would only have to pay me half wages !!  Take care - you need a rant anytime I will always be willing to listen & give any support / info I can. xxx
Posts.Title: Scared!!

Posts.Content: Hi Amanda - I just want to say I agree with all Janice just said on her post. I - like her - was diagnosed in Sept 2011 & am a single parent of 2 boys 14 a 18. Sometimes it felt that I wanted to curl up in a ball & say " leave me alone I cant do this - dont want to play this game anymore" but you just cant do that as that means the gremlins have won. Your husband & your kids will be your reason for being strong - it must be hard for you having 9 kids but thats 9 good reasons for you to stay positive. 10 with your husband. I know exactly what you mean about how you feel about your Mum dying. I felt the same with my boys & my Mum but mostly my sister as they were very close to her & she was only 55 when she died 2 yrs ago ( I'm now 54 ) I dont know the ages of your children but be honest as you can with them - explain to them that breast cancer is a different thing to womb cancer. Thats what I tried to stress to my boys as my sis died of womb cancer. They may not want to start the conversation with you but its important you reassure them by not trying to ignore it. Its a hard conversation to have but nessesary to make then aware of whats going on. You will be suprised at how resiliant they are - I know mine suprised me thats for sure & Im proud of them for it. Take care & keep posting to let me know how you are doing. xx
Posts.Title: Scared!!

Posts.Content: Hi Amanda - have sent you a private message in reply to yours which I got. Hope you got it ? hugs xx
Posts.Title: Scared!!

Posts.Content: Hi Amanda - Firstly Im sorry you find yourself on this site. I know how scared you are feeling - I was diagnosed last September. However you will find lots of help & support from all the ladies on this site. You will be able to have a rant & rave as there is always someone here to listen & support you with good advice - belive it or not you will even find humour here - hard to believe for you at this early stage I know. I know what you mean about never getting over your Mum - I lost mine to colon cancer in 2004 & my sister to womb cancer 2 years ago tomorrow. I am 54 & just want a cuddle from my Mum & for her to tell me it will be allright. The further on down the road of this nightmare you get you will find it easier & as hard as it is to believe now the light at the end of the long tunnel will burn brighter with each bit of treatment you go through.  I dont know how old your girls are, I have 2 sons of 14 & 18 & I found being honest with then was the best thing I could do to help them cope. Children are more resiliant than we give them credit for no matter what age. Dont forget - if you need a moan you can always contact me or someone on here. Take care & remenber that each day passed is a day nearer recovery. xxx
Posts.Title: Scared!!

Posts.Content: Hi Amanda - havent heard from you for a while - do you know your plan of action against the gremlins as I know you were going on 10th April ? Hope you are coping. Janice - hows things going with you ? I start my radio on Monday ( hope its not Radio 4 ! ) but thinking it will be a breeze now just a pain having to go every day for 5 weeks. Still, if it works ......... Take care everyone else & keep thinking positive thoughts xxx
Posts.Title: Scared!!

Posts.Content: Hiya- I have been taking Anastrozole for the past 5 weeks & I get joint pain which I believe can be normal. Its worse when I get up in the morning until I get moving & if I sit for too long. The night sweats come & go & are not as bas as they were when I was having the chemo. I have an appointment on Aug 3rd to see how its going with the meds but dont really expect them to do anything as its par for the course I think. Take care xx
Posts.Title: Joint pain

Posts.Content: Hold onto your kids tight as they will help you get through this nightmare. They are very resilient & are the driving force behind us Mums to stay strong on the road to coping, keeping our sense of "normality" & eventually beating this; have your crying time as its does us good but remember to keep your sense of humour along the way as well; All the very best for 2012 - this time next year it will all be a distant memory. xx
Posts.Title: Starting to walk into my new world, small steps but moving :-)

Posts.Content: Hi Mishka,   Just to add to what I already said about kids - if it would be of any help to contact me direct then I would be only too glad to "share notes" as it were as my two are also 13 & 18 (both boys ). Its hard for them both as my Mum & Sister also had cancer. I know how it feels to have your heart ripped out when your kids are so worried for you, they shouldnt have to go through that at such a young age - it just might help you seeing as I know how you must feel & sometimes its easier to speak to a stranger as family/friends can be too close - so feel free & dont feel alone. XX
Posts.Title: Starting to walk into my new world, small steps but moving :-)

Posts.Content: Hiya - no breast cancer nurses here in France either so know how you feel. I have just finished 25 sessions of rads yesterday & had them just on my mx site - in answer to your burn question I have been left burnt to a crisp & given some cream to put on from yesterday as they couldnt give me this during treatment. Reading the notice with it its specifically for rads burns plus 1st & 2nd degree burns. Was told it would be "better" in 2 weeks. I hope you get some answers to your rads site question. Good luck xx
Posts.Title: Radiotherapy question

Posts.Content: Hi Tracy - Congrats - know how you feel as I had my last treatment on Tuesday also. I dont know about you but after all the hospital trips although happy to be finished I feel a bit lost now. Crazy eh ?! Take care & good luck for the continuation of a "normal" life now xx
Posts.Title: last of treatment on tuesday

Posts.Content: Hi Ellen, Thanks for your post. I like you have one boob & am a "lady-boy" on the other side. I had my mastectomy 4 weeks ago tomorrow & started my chemo yesterday so have been told my christmas prezzie will be a bald head. I have already got my wig upstairs in its box - those who I have shown it to have said its amazing & so like my own hair & my eldest son was talking to me for 15 mins when I tried it on & didnt realise I had one on til I whipped it off ( mind you he is 18 & they dont notice much at that age unless it concerns them !! ) I take courage in what you have said & when the time comes then perhaps I will be able to shave my head as well. Its crazy as it upsets me more the thought of loosing my hair than the fact I have lost a boob - why is that ? I mean its totally illogical as hair grows back & boobs dont.  Anyway keep positive, keep your sense of humour as without that its a lot harder.  best wishes Suzie xx
Posts.Title: has shaved my head ! :)

Posts.Content: Hi Amanda - my 1st Tax was awful - dreaded the next but took Tramadol painkillers as precaution which worked, so 2nd Tax not as bad as 1st & 3rd one not as bad as 2nd. Hope it goes the same for you. Good luck - Oh & I havent lost any weight either. Perhaps because one of the only things I could actually taste was dark chocolate so as a change from chipboard I ate that now & again - lots of it !! Diet time now - dont worry about any weight issues before the end of treatment as one thing at a time xx
Posts.Title: last of treatment on tuesday

Posts.Content: Hi Marilyn I too have always been known for my thick hair so was more distressed about losing it than the fact I was now a "ladyboy" how crazy is that as hair grows back - boobs dont. The night it really started to come out in clumps in the shower I howled like a baby - got myself dressed - pulled myself together & headed up to my best mates armed with hair clippers & a bottle of wine. 10 mins later the deed was done & I felt lots better & less stressed - I amazed even myself with how relieved I felt - it was done & that was that. I do get a bit freaked out when I look in the mirror with no wig/head covering & feel more like Gollum than Sinead O'Connor - BUT - it will grow back & this time next year ir will be all like a horrible dream. I have my 3rd chemo of 6 this weds coming so halfway there Good luck & all the best xx
Posts.Title: has shaved my head ! :)

Posts.Content: The lady I bought my wig from sold me special shampoo for mine - perhaps you should get in touch with who you got it from. good luck Suzie x
Posts.Title: wigs

Posts.Content: Hi Mimi, I live in France so I cant help you out as it was shampoo that is made by the same company as the wigs. She told me not to use baby shampoo but perhaps that was just cos she wanted me to buy her product ? Sorry cant be of more help but on the bottle its marked that its enriched with silk proteins. suzie
Posts.Title: wigs

Posts.Content: Hi Earls When I had my chemo I had the ewact same as you. Had the Tax on the Weds & felt fine until the sat - sunday was worse & by the sunday night I spent the night on the settee in tears with the bone pain. I never knew what bone pain was before that - but boy I know now. I phoned my GP on the mon morning & she prescribed me Tramadol. I took them straight away & the relief was almost instant (almost) & it just eased off after than until I was pain free by the tuesday evening. The next 2 Tax I was dreading so took the Tramadol from the sat morning as a precaution & I can honestly say, 100% hand on heart, I had no pain at all after the next 2 sessions. I wish I had been warned before so knew to take the Tramadol before the 1st bone pains started. I hope this is of some help & you manage to get some relief. Take care xxx
Posts.Title: HOW LONG!

Posts.Content: Hi All, Well thats it - I've done it - last chemo yesterday. I will eventually be on Arimidex & wondering if anyone whos on this or been on it can give me any info i.e. possible S/E's Thanks xx
Posts.Title: Amiridex

Posts.Content: Hi Christine, I had a mastectomy on Nov 18th & I still have a pulling on the scar tissue even though it has healed very well. I have a bit of numbness at the back of my arm at armpit level & not a lot of feeling where my boob used to be & down as far as the middle of my ribs at the side. It doesnt bother me too much & I just think its a small price to pay for getting rid of the gremlins. Hope you get on alright & hopefully I will get on like you with the Arimidex. I guess its just them getting & settling into the system. Take care xx
Posts.Title: Amiridex

Posts.Content: I used black nail varnish on my finger & toe nails all through my Tax & for a couple of weeks after & I never lost a nail at all & they are as strong & healthy as ever now. xx
Posts.Title: The wonders of evonail - day 13 no nail damage

Posts.Content: Hi Thanks for that will bare it in mind as presumably you have to take it same time every day. I will let you know how I get on but wont be starting it till the end of my rads which finish end of May.  Onwards & upwards eh ? xx
Posts.Title: Amiridex

Posts.Content: Hi SC, You are not being shallow or silly having these thoughts about your partner. I was only with mine for a year before I was diagnosed & gave him the option of baling out straight away. Luckily for me he didnt & told me not to be so stupid as I was the same person. I had a lumpectomy & then a mastectomy in Nov last year. I hated undressing in front of him ( we dont live together but he comes & stays a few times a week) & always kept covered up at first as like you i thought he would be repulsed. I finally plucked up courage to ask him if he wanted to see my scar & he said only if I was ready. He was brilliant. The problem is with us & how we see ourselves as women. Our men find it just as difficult but for different reasons. I am now bald due to chemo & he is still at my side supporting me. Give your partner a chance to show you he cares - you've been together for 7 years so dont underestimate him or his feelings for you. Good luck with the radiotherapy xx
Posts.Title: puckerred boob

Posts.Content: I had mx in nov & ended up wearing spagetti strap type nighties & found they worked very well. It was really good with drains, comfy to get on & off, nothing to rub against mx site & cool in fairly warm hospital room. Not expensive either. xx
Posts.Title: pyjamas
